required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oxygen Consumption and Heart Rate Response to Battle Rope Exercise Protocol Versus Upper Extremity Arm Bike Test in Adults With Spinal Cord Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Oxygen Consumption and Heart Rate Response to Battle Rope Exercise Protocol Versus Upper Extremity Arm Bike Test in Adults With Spinal Cord Injury

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare energy expenditure and metabolic outcomes of a novel seated battle rope protocol to seated maximal ramped upper extremity ergometry protocol in subjects with spinal cord injury.

primary_outcome.measure: Cardiorespiratory fitness as assessed by maximum oxygen uptake (VO2max)
primary_outcome.time_frame: about 10-15 minutes after start of the protocol
primary_outcome.description: VO2max will be measured using a portable metabolic cart (Cosmed k5b).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: about 10-15 minutes after start of the protocol

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of perceived exertion as assessed by the Borg 6-20 Perceived exertion scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: about 10-15 minutes after start of the protocol
secondary_outcome.description: The Borg 6-20 Perceived exertion scale score ranges from 6-20, higher score indicates a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: about 10-15 minutes after start of the protocol

clinical_study.condition: Spinal Cord Injury at T2 and Below

intervention.description: Participants will begin swinging the rope as previously described in the seated position using the double arm swing technique for 15 seconds at a cadence of 100 beats/ minutes with a 45 second rest break repeated 10 times.
A modified Young Men's Christian Association (YMCA) cycle test will be performed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Spinal cord lesion T2 or below
- Individuals with spinal cord injury for greater than six months
- Utilize manual wheelchair for greater than 10 hours a day
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current complaints of spinal, lower extremity or upper extremity pain or musculoskeletal disorder that prevents the subject from performing repetitive upper extremity cycling or grasping and swinging the weighted ropes against the floor
- A current diagnosis of a chronic or acute cardiovascular, metabolic, renal or pulmonary disease including use of a pacemaker
- Anyone currently taking beta blocker medication
- Anyone with blood pressure >140/90 at the time of testing or with in the 2 weeks prior to testing
- Diagnosed sickle cell disease or sickle cell trait
- Severe spasticity or joint contracture preventing subject from performing upper extremity cycling or swinging of weighted ropes
- Subjects with current decubital ulcers
- History of autonomic dysreflexia in the last 6 months
- Require physician follow-up prior to starting exercise based on PAR-Q+ questionnaire

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The Institute for Research and Rehabilitation (TIRR) Memorial Hermann

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
